item.title: Chole Masala (Chickpea curry)
item.description: This Diwali ( Indian festival of lights), I was looking for a recipe for the Diwali potluck that could serve around 9-10 people.

item.title: Mango srikhand - Indianstyle yogurt
item.description: If you love desserts but at the same time want something healthy and easy to make, this dish is sure to please you.

item.title: Chocolate chip oat banana bread
item.description: Tired of eating the same oatmeal for breakfast everyday? We have got your covered.

item.title: Coconut zucchini stir fry
item.description: Every other recipe that I have looked online for zucchini involves cheese.

item.title: Lemon Blueberry pancakes
item.description: I totally love pancakes for breakfast. They are healthy, tasty and so easy to make.

item.title: Miso Salmon - Dinner/Lunch
item.description: Salmon is one of my all time dinner time favorites. And why not?

item.title: Chocolate chia seed pudding - New ways
item.description: Chia seeds have been quite the hype in the last few years and for all the right reasons.

item.title: Coconut lime healthy cake
item.description: Who doesn’t love desserts? But we often shy away from the high calories that desserts usually have.

item.title: One pot Chicken Biryani - Spicy chicken and rice

item.title: Refreshing kiwi pineapple quencher
item.description: Smoothies are the craze of this generation and for all the right reasons.

item.title: Fruit and granola parfait
item.description: There are days when I am down with a lot of work and my mornings are super rushed, and I literally have neither the time nor energy to cook a healthy breakfast.

item.title: Avocado fudge brownies
item.description: Who doesn’t love brownies? But we often get intimidated by the amount of butter/oil and sugar and with that, hell lot of calories that these store bought treats have that we would rather skip.
